question_text:
Question 50 
[RCC Structures : Prestress Concrete]
An inverted T-shaped concrete beam 


1
B
 in the figure, with centroidal axis 
X
X

, is subjected to an
effective prestressing force of 1000 kN acting at the bottom kern point of the beam cross-section.  Also
consider an identical concrete beam 


2
B
 with the same grade of concrete but without any prestressing
force.
(Figure NOT to scale) 
 
The additional cracking moment (in 
.
KN m
) that can be carried by beam 
1
B
  in comparison to beam 
2
B
is _________ (rounded off to nearest integer). 
Ans. 299 to 301
